info.site: england[;] (isle of wight)[;] arreton or arreton down or shaleombe down[;] found by mr. dennett in 1816
info.other: 2 cross section drawings of chisel on reverse.[;] edge is somewhat chipped and damged.
info.remarks: It seems uncertain whether this is "the small bronze instrument" said to have been found in a barrow on Shalecombe Down in 1816, or whether it was found about the same time on Arreton Down.  Mr. Crawford is inclined to the latter view.
info.collection: Carisbrooke Museum.[;] Presented by Sir L. Holmes.
info.publications:
Hillies History of the Isle of Wight. Pt. i. p.6.[;]
Journ. Brit. Arch. Ass. Winchester. (1846) p. 151.[;]
Dennett MS. No 2. fig. iii.

info.publications: Archaeologica V 113. XXXVI 329[;] Evans Bronze. fig 8.

info.site: england[;] isle of wight[;] south arreton, arreton down

info.description: No Stop ridge.

info.site: england[;] isle of wight[;] arreton down[;] 1735/7.

info.site: isle of wight[;] south arreton, arreton down
info.other: Weight is very difficult to make out on card, may be 444.25 or something else entirely[;] 2 cross section drawings of dagger attached to reverse on top of drawing on card.  Text "SL. 745 F. of Wight. e"[;] Portion of blade near hilt plate missing, long v-shaped ornamentation on face of blade with rounded end close to hilt plate.
info.description: 1 rivet hole & 1 broken.[;] hilt plate chipped & dented.
info.publications: Archaeologia V 113 XXXVI 329[;] Hor. Fer. VII 18

info.site: england[;] isle of wight[;] south arreton, arreton down
info.other: 2 cross section drawings of palstave taped to reverse.[;] butt notched.[;] Association, part of a hoard of 2 flanged axes, 1 dagger, and 2 other spearheads.
info.description: High mid rib. with 4 ribs on right & 3 on left.
info.publications:
Archaeologia 113. XXXVI. 329[;]
Kemble & Frankes Horae Ferales pl. VI. pgs 24 & 25.

info.site: isle of wight[;] south arreton[;] arreton down
info.other: 4 cross section drawings of spearhead on reverse with text "SL. 746 F. of Wight".[;] 3 ribs running down face of blade on one side, 4 on the other.[;] Rivet hole is broken in half and missing at bottom of tang.
info.surface: green with golden bronze showing through; rather rough with corrosion on tang

info.site: england[;] isle of wight[;] south arreton[;] arreton down

info.site: england[;] isle of wight[;] south arreton[;] arreton down

info.publications: Archaeologia XXXVI p 328 No. 6.[;] Horae Ferales Pl VI Fig 18

info.site: england[;] isle of wight[;] arreton[;] combley farm
info.other: 3 cross section drawings of palstave on reverse.[;] Surface very pitted and corroded, portions of blade slightly chipped.[;] Butt rounded and chipped.[;] Flanges appear slightly decayed.

info.site: isle of wight[;] arreton

info.remarks: Found between the Farm & the Church, in draining[;] Given by, Miss Roach.
info.description: wide flanges. slight stop ridges with 3 slight ribs above

info.site: isle of wight[;] arreton[;] arreton down
info.surface: dull gold mainly, merging to dark brown for lower part of tang; odd pits (small) dark brown & one or two with green corrosion products.[;] None of damage to edges is obviously modern, file-marks, and tang, rounding corners, may be modern
info.description: Either blade wing has a swollen centre line with bend outside; midrib asymmetrical on face, more-or-less symm. on reverse; triangular facet at tang/blade junction rounded - original or modern rubbing?[;] Hammer ripple mark on Faces of tang, and sides; tang twisted with respect to blade;
info.publications: Needham 1985, A6 no. 9

info.site: isle of wight[;] arreton[;] combley farm
